intro: Brossaea scabra, commonly known as the rough brossaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that are typically gray-green in color, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Brossaea scabra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments.
